subclassFeatures.name: Way of The Moon Soul
entries: Monks of the Way of The Moon Soul are strong, capable warriors, who use their style of fighting to unleash powerful attacks. Their stoic nature keeps them in a calm state of constant meditation, allowing them to be unflappable in the face of danger.

Unlike the Way of The Sun Soul, they are more defensive and fight in the front lines, focussing all their efforts to take down one enemy at a time. They will also attempt to avoid conflict if possible, but aren't afraid to get their hands dirty.

entries.name: Fist of The New Moon
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you can catch enemies off guard with a powerful opening strike.
You have advantage on initiative rolls, and you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that haven't taken a turn in combat yet.

In addition, the first creature you hit on your first turn of combat takes an extra {@dice 1d10} radiant damage. This damage changes as you gain monk levels—to {@dice 2d10} at 5th level, {@dice 3d10} at 11th level, and {@dice 4d10} at 17th level.

entries.name: Path of Illumination
entries: Also at 3rd level when you choose this tradition, you can cast the {@spell light} cantrip at will, requiring no components. The light is a special light however, as it sheds moonlight instead of normal light.
In addition, you either gain darkvision out to a range of 30 feet (if you don't have any), or increase it by 30.

entries.name: Channeling The Night
entries: Starting at 6th level, You gain the ability to invoke the powers of the Moon bestowed upon you.

You gain the ability to cast the {@spell Moonbeam} and {@spell Faerie Fire} spells once per short or long rest each. In addition, when you reach 17th level, you gain the ability to cast the {@spell guiding bolt} spell once per short or long rest.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is Wisdom.

entries.name: Crescent Shield
entries: Also at 6th level, while you are not carrying a shield, you can use your bonus action to manifest a barrier of light. For 1 minute, or until you are hit, you have a +2 bonus to AC, as if you were wielding a shield. Whenever a creature hits you, the shield shatters in a burst of lunar energy. Each creature within 5 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw against your ki save DC or take {@dice 1d10} + your Wisdom modifier in radiant damage.
This damage changes as you gain monk levels—to {@dice 2d10} at 11th level and {@dice 3d10} at 17th level.
Once you use this ability, you must finish a short or long rest before using it again.

entries.name: Full Moon Strike
entries: At 11th level, if you move at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with an unarmed strike or monk weapon on the same turn, you can spend 1 ki point to have the target take an extra {@dice 1d6} radiant damage from the attack.

You can increase the strike’s damage by spending ki points. Each point you spend increases the damage by {@dice 1d6}. The maximum number of ki points (the first 1 plus the additional points) that you can spend on the feature is 6.
You can use this feature only once on each of your turns.

entries.name: Lunar Eclipse
entries: At 17th level, you can call upon the might of the moon itself. As a bonus action, you can expend 4 ki points to enter into a lunar trance, for 1 minute. While in a lunar trance, your eyes change into bright moons, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.
You become immune to radiant damage.
Each of your melee weapon attacks deals an additional {@dice 1d6} radiant damage.

entries: After using this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.
You also no longer provoke opportunity attacks when you move out of an enemy’s reach.

subclassFeatures.name: Way of the Wild
entries: Monks of the Way of the Wild are rare, and almost all of them have a different background and way of fighting.
Unlike most Monks, these monks have more in common with Druids or Rangers, and most Rangers might pick this subclass for close-quarters combat.

entries.name: Tranquil as the Forest
entries: Due to your connection with nature and the forces that bind it, your Mystical touch can heal wounds. Starting at 3rd level, you have a pool of magical healing power that replenishes when you take a long rest. With that pool, you can restore a total number of hit points equal to your monk level × 10.
As an action, you can touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in the pool.

Instead of healing the creature, you can expend 5 hit points from your pool of healing to cure the target of one disease or neutralize one poison affecting it. You can cure multiple diseases and neutralize multiple poisons with a single use of Healing Hands, expending hit points separately for each one.
When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can replace one of the unarmed strikes with a use of this feature.
This feature has no effect on undead and constructs.

entries.name: Reclusive Mind
entries: Whether by will of a larger order or by your own personal training, you hone your disciplines by spending extended periods of time in the wild. Choose one bonus Proficiency from: Animal Handling, Nature or Survival.

entries.name: Touch of Thorns
entries: Starting 6th Level, you gain the ability to manipulate plants into deadly thorns.
You gain the ability to cast the {@spell Thorn Whip} Cantrip. In addition, you can also spend 3 ki points to cast the {@spell Spike Growth} spell.
Wisdom is your Spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Ancient Oak's Acumen
entries: Starting at 11th level your attunement with nature has expanded your senses. Your meditations in the forest have taught you to recognize the flow of ki through all creatures, regardless of origin. You can direct your attacks towards an enemy's ki which are invisible to other beings and most other monks: You can use Wisdom instead of Dexterity for the Attack and Damage Rolls for your unarmed strikes, with which you then deal psychic damage.

entries.name: Wild Spirits
entries: At 17th Level, you uncover the ability to enhance your allies using the power of the Spirits of Nature.
When you are below half of your total hit points, all allies within 30ft of you gain to-hit and damage bonuses equal to your Wisdom Modifier.

subclassFeatures.name: The Marauder
entries: The archetypal Marauder focuses on brute force to overcome their enemies.
Those who model themselves on this archetype combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows.

entries.name: Concussive Blows
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you strike with uncanny force. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
The saving throw DC for this feature is calculated as follows: 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Brawny
entries: Starting at 7th level, your muscles grow larger. You gain proficiency in the Athletics skill, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses Athletics.
Aditionally, whenever you are required to make an Intimidation check, you may make the check as a Strength ({@skill Intimidation}) check, instead of Charisma.

entries.name: Stay Down
entries: Starting at 10th level, you learn to subdue your enemies. When a creature within 5 feet of you stands up, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against them.
If the target is knocked prone, their speed becomes 0 until the end of their turn.

entries.name: Tenacity
entries: Starting at 15th level, your persistence is unrivaled. You can use your Second Wind feature twice before you must finish a short or long rest to use it again.

entries.name: Finishing Blow
entries: Starting at 18th level, you learn the best way to crack a skull. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can add 10 + your Strength modifier to the attack's damage.
If a creature drops to 0 hit points in this way, it is killed instantaneously.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Knights of The Emperor
entries: During the 8th Era, Emperor Gelebrom Ellesar decided that the main two guard forces of Gháidhealtachd—The Wood- and Moonwatchers—weren't enough, and decided that he needed a third force of warriors; The Harpers—or Rune Knights.
Rune Knights come in two different forces; those of brute force—The Fighters—and those of the magicks—The Sorcerers—.
Rune Knights are thus knights that have learned how to enhance their martial prowess using the supernatural ancient elven power of runes.

This ancient practice actually originated with Giants, which the ancient Elves created by Corellon learned from them by appeasing them with food and gifts. However, since then, Elvish Rune Knights and Giant Rune Knights are two wholly different things.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb}, and you learn to speak, read, and write Sylvan.

entries.name: Rune Magic
entries: You learn how to use runes to enhance your gear. When you gain this feature, you learn how to inscribe two runes of your choice on weapons, armor, or shields (see "{@filter Rune Options|optionalfeatures|feature type=RN|source=Nymm}").

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch a number of objects equal to the number of runes you know, and you inscribe a different rune onto each of the objects. To be eligible, an object must be a weapon, a suit of armor, or a shield.
Your rune remains on an object until you finish a long rest, and an object can bear only one of your runes.
Each time you gain a level in this class, you can replace one rune you know with a different one.

entries.name: Rune Options
entries: Detailed below are the rune options for the Rune Magic feature. They are all magical effects. If a rune requires a saving throw, your Rune Magic save DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: {@i Amon} (Hill Rune)
entries: This rune's magic bestows a resilience as strong as the grey hills, a highland in the southern reaches of Gháidhealtachd. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance against poison damage.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action, gaining resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute. Once you invoke the rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: {@i Naur} (Fire Rune)
entries: This rune's magic channels the masterful craftsmanship of sunfire elven smiths. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses your proficiency with a tool.

In addition, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can invoke the rune to summon fiery shackles: the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. While {@condition restrained} by the shackles, the target takes  {@dice 2d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, banishing the shackles on a success. Once you invoke the rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: {@i Ring} (Frost Rune)
entries: This rune's magic evokes the bitter cold the Elves of Wynde had to endure while learning from the Giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks and Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action to increase your Strength score by 2 for 10 minutes. This increase can cause your score to exceed 20, but not 30. Once you invoke the rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: {@i Fain} (Cloud Rune)
entries: This rune's magic emulates the deceptiveness of Corellon, the Deity of Elves. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks and Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks.

In addition, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to invoke the rune and cause that attack to target a different creature within 30 feet of you (other than the attacker), using the same roll. This magic can transfer the attack regardless of the attack's range. Once you invoke the rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: {@i Gond} (Stone Rune)
entries: This rune's magic channels the grace of Gháidhealtachd. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks, and you have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, its range increases by 30 feet.

In addition, when a creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to invoke the rune and force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature is {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the creature has a speed of 0 and is {@condition incapacitated}, descending into a dreamy stupor. The effect ends if the {@condition charmed} creature takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its haze. Once you invoke the rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: {@i Alagos} (Storm Rune)
entries: Using this rune, you can glimpse the future like an Elven visier. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) checks, and you can't be surprised as long as you are not {@condition incapacitated}.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action to enter a prophetic state for 1 minute or until you're {@condition incapacitated}. Until the state ends, when you or another creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, you can use your reaction to cause the roll to have advantage or disadvantage. Once you invoke the rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Shard's Might
entries: You can imbue yourself with the might of the magical spire-like temple floating above the Elven Gardens. As a bonus action, you magically gain the following benefits, which last for 1 minute:

items: If you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If you lack the room to become Large, your size doesn't change.
You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
Your weapon attacks deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage.

entries: You can use this feature twice, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Defensive Runes
entries: You learn to invoke your rune magic to protect your allies. When another creature you can see within 60 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to grant a bonus to the creature's AC against that attack. The bonus equals 1 + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +2).
In addition, you learn one new rune of your choice from the Rune Magic feature (for a total of three).

entries.name: Secrets of Alteration
entries: The magic of your runes permanently alters you, permanently and harmlessly branding the rune on your forehead, so whenever you use your abilities it lights up, and fades back to be invisible once more. In addition, the extra damage you deal with your Shard's Might feature increases to {@dice 1d8}.
In addition, you learn one new rune of your choice from your Rune Magic feature (for a total of four).

entries.name: Rune Magic Mastery
entries: You can invoke each rune you know from your Rune Magic feature twice, rather than once, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.
In addition, you learn one new rune of your choice from the Rune Magic feature (for a total of five).

entries.name: Radiance of Avandor
entries: You learn how to share your rune magic with your allies. When you use your Shard's Might feature, you can choose one willing creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The chosen creature also gains the benefits of your Shard's Might feature.

subclassFeatures.name: Blessed Protector
entries: A vanguard is a blessed fighter who protects their allies through self-sacrifice.
Those who take up this archetype stand their ground against any adversary, willing to lay down their lives for the greater good.
Vanguard are blessed by deities of War or Protection, such as {@deity Helm|Nymm|Nymm}, {@deity Tempus|Nymm|Nymm}, {@deity The Red Knight|Nymm|Nymm}

entries.name: Aegis
entries: You are blessed with divine power that you can draw on to protect others from harm. When a creature attacks a target other than you that is within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to redirect the damage of that attack to yourself.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain all expended uses.
The range of this feature increases by 5 feet when you reach 5th level, 7th level, and 9th level.

entries.name: Fortitude
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your courage is unwavering in the face of danger to protect others. While a friendly creature is in range of your Aegis:
You have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks to ensure their safety.
You are immune to being frightened.
You gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Perseverance
entries: Starting at 7th level, your resolve to fulfill your duty is unrivaled. You can use your Second Wind feature twice before you must finish a short or long rest to use it again.

entries.name: Additional Fighting Style
entries: At 10th level, you can choose either Defense or Protection from the Fighting Style class feature.

entries.name: Improved Aegis
entries: Starting at 15th level, your Aegis has been bolstered by your determination. You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage redirected to you by your Aegis.

entries.name: Last Stand
entries: Starting at 18th level, if you are killed instantaneously, roll a death saving throw. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

subclassFeatures.name: Madness Domain

entries: A Warlock? I may be mad, but I'm not {@b that} mad!
entries.by: {@b {@i Fane Sorell Denholm}}, {@i The 1st White Duke}.

entries: Madness. Madness is both powerful and dangerous. Those who adopt this domain need a strong mind to resist its more perverse effect. Gods of the Maddness domain are often time devious, malevolent and manipulative, draining the sanity of mortals to increase their power. Other see themselves as liberators, and promise their followers that by offering their devotion to them, they will break the shackles of reason and reality that is holding their mind down, opening their mind to a whole new world of possibility.

Cleric choosing this domain can sometimes find themselves lost in thoughts with themselves, rambling incohenrently or debating the most outlandish subjects. In the Realm of Nymm and Mist, the deities of this domain include {@deity Cyric|Nymm|Nymm} and {@deity Maglubiyet|Mist|Mist} respectively. In the new world, the world of Rûhne, these gods include {@deity Torog|The Dark Ones|Rûhne}, {@deity Zehir|The Dark Ones|Rûhne}, {@deity Iuz|The Dark Ones|Rûhne} and especially {@deity Tharizdun|The Dark Ones|Rûhne}.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared. They do not count towards your limit.

entries.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip. It is a cleric cantrip for you, and does not count against your maximum number of cleric cantrips.

entries.name: Inscrutable Mind
entries: Also at 1st level, your mind becomes a place where reality is a vague concept at best, giving you a very colorful imagination. You become proficient in the {@skill Deception} skill.

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Madness Overtaking
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to call upon your deity to taint your magic with the seeds of insanity.

When you cast one of your domain spells, you can expand a use of Channel Divinity to select a target. If there are multiple target, choose one among all the targets affected by your spell. That target must make an additional Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. If the creature fails, it becomes afflicted with a randomly determined short term madness (see "{@book Madness Effects|dmg|8|Madness Effects}" in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide).

entries.name: Spreading Insanity
entries: Your magic becomes so potent that it can affect the minds of multiple creatures.

Starting at 6th level, when you use your Channel Divinity to use the Madness Overtaking feature, you can affect a number of creatures within 30 feet equal to your Wisdom modifier. Roll a random short term madness for each affected creatures.

entries.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

entries.name: Creeping Mania
entries: Starting at 17th level, your insidious magic takes hold of your target’s mind and assaults it until it shatters, turning your victims into gibbering messes.

At the beginning of a creature’s turn that is under a charm effect from one of your spells or magical effects, it takes 3d8 psychic damage. Taking damage from this effect doesn’t provoke any additional Wisdom check to try and break the effects of the charm.

subclassFeatures.name: Trickery Domain

entries: Thief! Search the halls, the Queen's Crown has been stolen!

Gods of trickery—such as {@deity Tymora|Nymm|Nymm}, {@deity Beshaba|Nymm|Nymm} and {@deity Cyric|Nymm|Nymm}—are mischief-makers and instigators who stand as a constant challenge to the accepted order among both gods and mortals. They're patrons of thieves, scoundrels, gamblers, rebels, and liberators. Their clerics are a disruptive force in the world, puncturing pride, mocking tyrants, stealing from the rich, freeing captives, and flouting hollow traditions. They prefer subterfuge, pranks, deception, and theft rather than direct confrontation.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill and {@item thieves' tools|PHB}.

entries.name: Blessing of the Trickster
entries: Also at 1st level, you can use your action to touch yourself or a willing creature to give it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Invoke Duplicity
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to create an illusory duplicate of yourself.

As an action, you create a perfect illusion of yourself that lasts for 1 minute. The illusion appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of you. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the illusion up to 30 feet to a space you can see, but it must remain within 120 feet of you.

For the duration, you can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space, but you must use your own senses. Additionally, if the illusion is within 5 feet of you, creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you, given how distracting the illusion is to the target.

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Cloak of Shadows
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity to vanish.
You can, on your turn, as a bonus action, become invisible until the end of your next turn. You become visible if you attack or cast a spell.
Additionally, as a reaction to taking damage, you can expend a use of your Channel Divinity to turn invisible until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

entries.name: Improved Duplicity
entries: At 17th level, you can create up to four duplicates of yourself, instead of one, when you use Invoke Duplicity. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move any number of them up to 30 feet, to a maximum range of 120 feet.

subclassFeatures.name: The Deviant
entries: The Deviant Warlock is a Warlock that specializes in the art of Trickery and Deception. They might have secret identities or other such spells to mask their identities, and are notorious for wreaking havoc wherever they may pass.
Your patron is a deity of a Trickery domain; ideally Cyric, Mask or Leira. Any devil might do too, such as a Succubus, Rakshasa (These work very well) or some other Tricksy Fiend.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Deviant lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: Starting at 1st level, you learn the {@spell friends} and {@spell minor illusion} cantrips. They don’t count against your number of cantrips known.

entries.name: Crown of Lies
entries: Also starting at 1st level, when you cast Friends, you can choose whether the creature realizes you used magic to influence its mood or not.
In addition, when you make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check to have someone believe something you say, treat a roll of 7 or lower on the d20 as an 8.

entries.name: Sudden Duplicity
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use your reaction to cast the {@spell mirror image} once without expending a spell slot. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Doppelganger
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can create an illusionary duplicate of yourself at will. Unlike other illusionary duplicates, it seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to yourself.
While not in combat, the illusionary duplicate can perform simple tasks such as standing watch, relaying a message, performing an act, and aiding another creature verbally.
The illusionary duplicate will remain until you use this feature again, dismiss it, or if you are more than 120 feet away from it.

entries.name: Malefic Illusions
entries: Starting at 14th level, your illusionary duplicates can deal damage or otherwise directly harm anyone.
When an illusionary duplicate mimics a weapon attack it deals {@dice 1d6} + your Charisma modifier in psychic damage.

subclassFeatures.name: Path of the Wild Soul
entries: The realm of the Feywild abounds with beauty, unpredictable emotion, and rampant magic. A barbarian exposed to this realm feels emotions powerfully and magic saturates their body.
When a barbarian who follows this path rages, it is a bellowing roar for freedom, an explosion of expression, manifesting in unpredictable ways.

entries.name: Lingering Magic
entries: At 3rd level, your body reacts to the presence of magic. You can cast the {@spell detect magic} spell without using a spell slot or components. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell. You faintly glow a color corresponding to the school of magic you detect (you choose the colors).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Wild Surge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, magic erupts from you as you rage. When you enter your rage, roll on the Wild Surge table to determine the magical effect produced.
If the wild surge requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.

entries.caption: Wild Surge
rows: Necrotic energy bursts from you. Each creature within 30 feet of you takes {@dice 1d10} necrotic damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt to the creatures.
You teleport up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Until your rage ends, you can activate this effect again on each of your turns as a bonus action.

You conjure {@dice 1d4} intangible spirits that look like {@creature flumph||flumphs} in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of you. Each spirit immediately flies 30 feet in a random direction. At the end of your turn, all spirits explode and each creature within 5 feet of one or more of them must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 2d8} force damage.

Arcane energy enshrouds you. Until your rage ends, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, and whenever a creature within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack, that creature takes force damage equal to your Constitution modifier.
Plant life temporarily grows around you: until your rage ends, the ground within 10 feet of you is difficult terrain.

Arcane energy taps into the minds of those around you. Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed ona Wisdom saving throw or you see a glimpse of the creature's thoughts, learning how it plans to attack you. As a result, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn.

Shadows weave around a weapon of your choice you are holding. Until your rage ends, your weapon deals psychic damage instead of its bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage, and it gains the light and thrown properties with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If you drop the weapon or throw it, the weapon dissipates and reappears in your hand at the end of your turn.

A beam of brilliant light lances from your chest in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 2d8} radiant damage and be {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Magic Reserves
entries: At 6th level, you can channel the magic surging inside you into other creatures. As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a {@dice d4}. The creature recovers an expended spell slot of a level equal to the number rolled. If the creature you touch can't recover a spell slot of that level, the creature instead gains temporary hit points equal to five times the number rolled.
You take force damage equal to five times the number rolled.
When you reach 14th level in this class, you increase the die to a {@dice d6}.

entries.name: Arcane Rebuke
entries: At 10th level, the magic crackling within your soul lashes out. When a creature forces you to make a saving throw while you are raging, you can use your reaction to deal {@dice 3d6} force damage to that creature.

entries.name: Chaotic Fury
entries: At 14th level, you become a wellspring of wild magic while you are raging. As a bonus action, you can reroll on the Wild Surge table, replacing your current effect with the new one.

entries.name: Improved Magic Reserves
entries: At 14th level, your magic reserves die changes to a {@dice d6}.

subclassFeatures.name: Circle of the Mushroom
entries: Druids of the circle of the mushroom are mellow protectors of the fungal jungles. Their order gathers amid clouds of spores, stumbling through the deepest, most toxic clouds, sustained by visions of strange alternate realities, the very essence that ties these druids to a nature both more wondrous and strange than regular mortals can perceive.

entries.name: Truth of the Mushrooms
entries: Your link to fungus and your ability to tap into hazy visions and strange toxins grants you access to certain spells. At 2nd level, you learn the {@spell infestation|XGE} cantrip. At 3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th level you gain access to the spells listed for that level in the Circle of the Mushroom Spells table.

Once you gain access to a circle spell, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn't appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

entries.name: Wild Shape: Explosive Caps
entries: Also at 2nd level, as a bonus action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to to grow special, magically imbued explosive mushroom caps on yourself, rather than transforming into a beast form, and you gain 4 temporary hit points for each level you have in this class.
You gain a total number of explosive caps equal to your level + your wisdom modifier (minimum of 1, rounded down).

Explosive caps last for 1 day or until you complete a long rest before withering and becoming inert. Thrown explosive caps detonate and cannot be salvaged after combat. You treat explosive caps as simple ranged weapons with the finesse and thrown (range 20/60) properties. You are considered proficient with explosive caps. Explosive caps deal {@dice 2d6} necrotic damage on a hit.
While there is at least 1 explosive cap still active, you can expend one spell slot to regain 1 use of explosive caps per level of the spell slot expended.

entries.name: Fungal Infestation
entries: At 6th level, your spores gain the ability to infest a corpse and animate it. If a beast or a humanoid that is Small or Medium dies within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to animate it, causing it to stand up immediately with 1 hit point. The creature uses the {@creature zombie} stat block in the {@book Monster Manual|MM}. It remains animate for 1 hour, after which time it collapses and dies.
In combat, the zombie's turn comes immediately after yours. It obeys your mental commands, and the only action it can take is the {@action Attack} action, making one melee attack.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spell-powered Caps
entries: At 10th level, gain the ability to imbue your explosive caps with magic. This magic is represented as spores. You gain a number of spores equal to your wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).
You can then spend these spores as part of an attack using your explosive caps.

entries.name: Aerodynamic Cap
entries: When you throw one of your explosive caps, you can spend one spore to increase the range by 30 feet.

entries.name: Empowered Cap
entries: When you throw an explosive cap, you can empower the cap, dealing an extra {@dice 1d6} force damage per spore.

entries.name: Hallucinogenic Cap
entries: When you throw a cap, you can spend 2 spores to change it to a hallucinogenic cap.

When you throw this cap, it detonates leaving behind a wispy 5 foot cloud of spores that lasts until the end of your next turn. A target hit must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against you spell save DC or become {@condition incapacitated} until the cloud vanishes.

entries.name: Fast Cap
entries: When you throw an explosive cap, you can spend 2 spores to change the throwing time to 1 bonus action.

entries.name: Halluconagenic Immunity
entries: Also at 10th level, continuous exposure to fungus-based toxins and hallucinogens has changed your body. You become immune all diseases. Additionally, you gain advantage on all saving throws to resist the effects of plant-based toxins and drugs.

entries.name: Fungal Body
entries: At 14th level, the fungal spores in your body alter you: you can't be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened} or {@condition poisoned}, and any critical hit against you counts as a normal hit instead, unless you're {@condition incapacitated}.
In addition, you no longer need to eat or drink as the spores provide you with nutrients.

entries: Kobolds reach adulthood at age 6 and can live up to 120 years but rarely do so.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Kobolds are fundamentally selfish, making them evil, but their reliance on the strength of their group makes them trend toward law.

entries.name: Size

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Grovel, Cower, and Beg

entries.name: Pack Tactics

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity

entries.name: Age

entries.name: Alignment

Good Derro have been known to exist, though they are quickly exiled from their enclaves or murdered outright by their kin.

entries.name: Size
entries: Derro are short, stunted creatures. They stand between 3 and 4 feet tall with slender limbs but wide shoulders. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed

entries.name: Superior Darkvision

entries.name: Insanity

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Xenophobic
entries: Distrustful and suspicious of others to the point of paranoia, you have disadvantage on all Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks when dealing with non-Derro.

entries.name: Born to Madness
entries: You know the {@spell message} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Dissonant Whispers} spell once per day; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Minor Madness
entries: All derro are insane, but some exhibit more extreme behaviors than others. A variety of fetishes and compulsions affects this twisted race, and with the permission of the DM, the derro character is strongly encouraged to partake from the cup of madness.

These examples of insanity are meant to be roleplaying features, but the DM or the player may add suitable ingame effects by mutual agreement. A player can also invent other forms of lesser madness with the DM's approval.

entries.caption: Minor Madness
rows: Collector; roll on subtable 1 for specific object
Pica (eats nonfood objects); roll on subtable 1 for specific object
Irrational prejudice against creature; roll on subtable 2 for specific creature
Taboo (cannot touch or interact with creature); roll on subtable 2 for specific creature
Phobia (strong fear of creature); roll on subtable 2 for specific creature
Obsessed with creature; roll on subtable 2 for specific creature

entries.caption: Subtable 1: Small Objects
rows: Bones, hair, nails, or bugs (dead or alive)
Deodands (items responsible for the death of a creature)
Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes, or other body parts
Hats, socks, gloves, or other clothing
Holy symbols, religious goods or books

entries.caption: Subtable 2: Living Creatures
rows: Chicken, cat, dog, sheep, cow, or other domestic animal (pick a type)
Elf, dwarf, human, kobold, or other humanoid (pick subtype)
Rat, giant centipede, gelatinous cube, or other giant vermin or ooze (pick type)
Sparrow, pigeon, hawk, owl, or other bird
Rat, wolf, mole, badger, or other mammal

entries.caption: Subtable 3: Delusions
rows: Imaginary friend; god/spirit who is friendly and encouraging
Imaginary friend; god/spirit who is hateful and discouraging
Believes she is a high noble
Believes he has fewer powers than he does
Believes she has more powers than she actually does
Convinced she has an important destiny
Convinced that an inanimate object (roll on subtable 1 above) is alive
Thinks she is a powerful polymorphed creature
Voices speak random gibberish and commands to character
Convinced that random patterns of either inanimate objects (subtable 1) or living things (subtable 2) have an important meaning and must be studied

entries.caption: Subtable 4: Physical Effects
rows: Leers and rolls eyes at some type of creature (roll on subtable 2)
Tic or tremor in body part
Mutters constantly to self in Deep Speech
Speaks inappropriate but true facts during diplomatic situations
Randomly speaks a word (chosen by GM) during combat or negotiation

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Undercommon and Dwarvish.

entries.name: Age
entries: Tieflings mature at the same rate as humans but live a few years longer.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Tieflings might not have an innate tendency toward evil, but many of them end up there. Evil or not, an independent nature inclines many tieflings toward a chaotic alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Tieflings are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your infernal heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Hellish Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Infernal.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Fey Legacy
entries: You know the {@spell Druidcraft} cantrip. At 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Charm Person} spell once per day at 2nd level, and at 5th level, you can cast the {@spell Pass without Trace} spell once per day. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Infernal and Sylvan.

entries.name: Age
entries: Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Dragonborn tend to extremes, making a conscious choice for one side or the other in the cosmic war between good and evil (represented by Bahamut and Tiamat, respectively). Most dragonborn are good, but those who side with Tiamat can be terrible villains.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: You can use a bonus action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes {@dice 1d12} damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to {@dice 2d12} at 5th level, {@dice 3d12} at 11th level, and {@dice 4d12} at 17th level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Draconic Strength
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Age
entries: Goblins reach adulthood at age 8 and live up to 60 years.

Sages believe that goblins weren't originally from Nymm, with their monsterous features and the murderous tendencies, they diverge from most .  Goblins themselves hold that they are among the original inhabitants of the world, though they are not known for having a long racial memory.
Ailmár leads the Harpers, the spy regiment of Fyvethir. Among the ranks are Runaan, a Dark-Elf whom the party has met before.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Forest goblins are typically neutral or neutral good, though some mischievous forest goblins are chaotic neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Forest goblins are smaller than their other counterparts; they are between 3 and 4 feet tall and weigh between 40 and 80 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide action} as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Fury of the Small
entries: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Speak with Small Beasts
entries: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest goblins love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Deep goblins are typically neutral evil, as they care only for their own needs. A few goblins might tend toward good or neutrality, but only rarely.

entries.name: Size
entries: Deep goblins are between 3 and 4 feet tall and weigh between 40 and 80 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Deep goblins thrive in the many caves and caverns beneath the world. thus, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Fury of the Small
entries: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

entries.name: Stoneskin
entries: You can move across difficult terrain made of earth or stone without expending extra movement.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Ash goblins are typically lawful evil, as ride in packs on their fearsome worgs, prefering to hunt together. A few goblins might tend toward good or neutrality, but only rarely.

entries.name: Size
entries: Ash goblins are the largest and strongest of the goblin subraces; they are anywhere between 4 and just under 5 feet tall and weigh between 80 and 120 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide action} as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Fury of the Small
entries: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Worg Rider
entries: Ash goblins have an amicable relationship with worgs, whom they ride into battle. You have proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling} skill.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

item.name: Parrying Dagger
entries: A parrying dagger is a special dagger used for parrying incoming attacks while holding a sword in the other hand. Wielding a parrying dagger increases your Armor Class by 1. You can benefit from only one parrying dagger at a time.

item.name: Mythcarver
entries: This incredible silvered blade once belonged to the White Duke himself, and many more master bards before him. It resonates with nearby musical tones. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.
Whenever you use your {@class bard|phb|Bardic Inspiration|College of Lore|phb|bardic inspiration 1} feature, you gain advantage on attacks with this weapon until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|awakens} Mythcarver, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Increase the bonus to attack and damage rolls to +2. In addition, targets damaged with this weapon take an additional {@dice 1d6} points of force damage.
Whenever you use your {@class bard|phb|Cutting Words|College of Lore|phb|bard college 3} feature while wielding this blade, the target has disadvantage on their next saving throw.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|exalts} Mythcarver, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Increase the bonus to attack and damage rolls to +3.

You can spend an action to let the spirit of the sword overtake you momentarily. You make four melee attacks with this sword, then suffer one point of exhaustion. You cannot use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Wraps of Dyamak
entries: Created and wielded by the ancient warrior called Dyamak, these thick cloth strips of enchanted material appear to be stained with blood of unknown origin. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with your unarmed strikes.
Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your full ki points.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|awakens} Wraps of Dyamak, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Increase your bonus to attack and damage rolls to +2.
As a bonus action, you can cast the spell {@spell misty step}. You cannot use this ability again until you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike, or you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|exalts} Wraps of Dyamak, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Increase your bonus to attack and damage rolls to +3.

When you hit with an unarmed strike, you can choose to make the attack a Ravenous Strike. The target takes an additional {@dice 6d6} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the additional necrotic damage dealt. You cannot use this ability again until you complete a short or long rest.

item.name: Titanstone Knuckles
entries: Carved from the heartstone of a ruined earth primordial, these gauntlets bestow immeasurable might to the wearer. Your Strength score becomes 22.
{@i Siege.} You deal double damage against objects and structures.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|awakens} Titanstone Knuckles, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Your Strength score becomes 24.
You can use an action to grow in size as per the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce|pbb|enlarge} spell for 10 minutes. You cannot use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|exalts} Titanstone Knuckles, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Your Strength score becomes 26.

While you are under the effects of the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce|pbb|enlarge} spell granted by this item, you gain resistance to fire, cold, and lightning damage. This lasts as long as you are affected by the spell.

item.name: Gem of Eternal Destiny
entries: A beautiful, glittering emerald is set within the center of this silver chain, humming with power and possibility. While wearing this amulet, you gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws, and are immune to the {@condition grappled} condition.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|awakens} Gem of Eternal Destiny, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Increase the bonus to all saving throws to a +2.
You become immune to the {@condition restrained} condition as well as the {@condition grappled} condition.
You may use an action to cast the spell {@spell blink} on yourself without needing any components. You cannot use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|exalts} Gem of Eternal Destiny, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Increase the bonus to all saving throws to a +3.
You become immune to the {@condition paralyzed} and {@condition petrified} conditions, as well as the {@condition restrained} and {@condition grappled} conditions.

Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can choose to roll an additional d20. You can choose to do this after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throws. You cannot use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Spire of Conflux (Awakened)
entries: A powerful relic passed down from generation to generation of archdruids from Gháidhealtachdwhich eventually led to it's previous owner (and itself) being swallowed whole by a Goristro named Urachk. The staff has 8 charges and regains {@dice 1d4+2} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the staff, you can expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability: {@spell burning hands} (1 charge), {@spell fireball} (3 charges).

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|awakens} Spire of Conflux, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: The staff's charges increase to a maximum of 12, and it regains {@dice 1d6+2} charges at dawn daily.
Add the following spells to the list of spells the staff may be used to cast: {@spell ice storm} (4 charges), {@spell conjure elemental} (5 charges).
Whenever you cast a spell that deals fire, ice, or lightning damage and you roll a 1 on a damage die, you can reroll the die and must use the new result.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|exalts} Spire of Conflux, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: The staff's charges increase to a maximum of 20, and it regains {@dice 1d6+4} charges at dawn daily.
Add the following spells to the list of spells the staff may be used to cast: {@spell chain lightning} (6 charges), {@spell fire storm} (7 charges).
While holding this staff, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls, and your spell save DC increases by 1.

item.name: Fenthras
entries: This gorgeous longbow made of everbark from the Feywild seems to flex and shift like a living entity. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

When firing an arrow from this weapon, you can declare an oracle shot, allowing you to project your sight through the arrow you fire for up to 10 minutes. You cannot use this ability again until you finish a short rest.
When a creature is killed by an arrow from this weapon, a single 6-ft tree rapidly grows out of their corpse over the next minute.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|awakens} Fenthras, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Increase the bonus to attack and damage rolls to a +2. Additionally when you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an additional {@dice 1d4} lightning damage.

When you hit with an attack, you can declare a bramble shot. The target takes an additional {@dice 3d8} piercing damage, and they must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} by the suddenly sprouting steel-hard thorn brambles that immediately grow from the arrow. The restrained target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. You cannot use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|exalts} Fenthras, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Increase the bonus to attack and damage rolls to a +3.
The lightning damage dealt by attacks with this weapon increases to {@dice 1d6}.
You can use your bramble shot ability twice between rests, and the saving throw DC increases to 17.

item.name: Whisper (Dormant)
entries: Forged with a mercurial metal pulled from the Far Realm, light dances and shifts across this curved blade. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

Whenever you strike a creature with a critical hit using Whisper, the target must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. On a success, they are immune to being frightened by this effect for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|awakens} Whisper, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Increase the bonus to attack and damage to a +2. Additionally, when you hit a target with this weapon, the target takes an additional {@dice 1d6} psychic damage.
Increase the DC to resist being {@condition frightened} from a critical hit to 15.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When a character {@variantrule The Advancement of a Vestige|Nymm|exalts} Whisper, apply the following changes to the item's traits:

items: Increase the bonus to attack and damage to a +3, and increase the additional damage taken to {@dice 1d8} psychic damage.
Increase the DC to resist being {@condition frightened} from a critical hit to 17.

Whenever Whisper is thrown but before it hits, you can choose to transform into shadow and merge with the blade, teleporting instantly to wherever the blade impacts. If the target is a creature, you emerge adjacent to the target in a space of your choice. If you miss with the attack, the DM determines where you teleport accordingly.

item.name: Blackout
entries: This large onyx longsword is forged from a obsidian, and gives off a faint, dark aura. It has runes etched at the bottom of the blade, which read; "{@i Blackout, Slicer of Shadows}" in Undercommon.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

Also, whenever you are targeted by a spell of 1st through 3rd level, you can use your reaction to have the sword swallow the spell. The sword gains a number of charges equal to the spell's level, to a maximum of 3.
In addition, whenever you score a critical hit using weapon, you deal an extra {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage, and gain temporary hit points equal to the amount dealt.

item.name: Blood Moon Blade
entries: This fine blade is crafted from a strange black material and bears a hole above the hilt that seems to draw in blood.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

In addition, whenever you hit a Small or larger creature with this weapon, that creature takes an extra 2d4 necrotic damage and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt in this way. Constructs, plants and undead are immune to this necrotic damage.

{@b Curse}. This sword is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the sword, keeping it within reach at all times. You also have disadvantage on attack rolls made with weapons other than this one, unless no foe is within 60 feet of you that you can see or hear. In addition, while you remain cursed, the number of hit points you regain when healed by magical means (other than the sword's effect) is halved.

item.name: Shadowsmoke Dragon Pipe

entries: I stole this. Let's be clear. All of it. This is the good kush.

This magical wooden pipe leaves behind odorless smoke that dissipates rapidly. The head of the pipe detaches, allowing you to refill it easily. The pipe has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d3 + 1} expended charges daily at dusk. As an action, you can expend a charge to blow a small, condensed smoke ring at a friendly creature (including yourself) that you can see within 30 feet of you.

A creature affected by the smoke ring in this way can choose to immediately turn invisible or wear the smoke as if it were a physical ring. The ring lasts for 1 minute or until the creature uses a bonus action on one of its turns to turn invisible. A creature turned invisible by the smoke ring reappears at the start of its next turn or when they attack or cast a spell. A creature can only have 1 smoke ring at any time.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards
items: Instrument of the Bards, Tar'lindal Flute
Instrument of the Bards, Kargvôst Bandore
Instrument of the Bards, Nôtliet Mandolin

item.name: Instrument of the Bards, Kargvôst Bandore
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college, in this case; the Kargvôst College in Id-Urâd. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition charmed} on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell fly}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell levitate}, and {@spell protection from evil and good}.
In addition, the Kargvôst Bandore can be used to cast {@spell compelled duel}, {@spell magic stone|XGE}, {@spell spike growth} and {@spell stoneskin}.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards, Tar'lindal Flute
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college, in this case; the Tar'lindal College in Gháidhealtachd. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition charmed} on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell fly}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell levitate}, and {@spell protection from evil and good}.
In addition, the Tar'lindal Flute can be used to cast {@spell entangle}, {@spell faerie fire}, {@spell shillelagh} and {@spell speak with animals}.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards, Nôtliet Mandolin
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college, in this case; the Nôtliet College in Underburrow. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition charmed} on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell fly}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell levitate}, and {@spell protection from evil and good}.
In addition, the Nôtliet Mandolin can be used to cast {@spell animal friendship} {@spell control water}, {@spell cure wounds} (3rd level) and {@spell plant growth}.

item.name: Oloore Root
entries: Oloore Root began as a druidic ceremonial tool for vision quests and communion with nature, but has become sought after by high society for its psychedelic properties. Drinking of the tea brewed from the root leads to heavy hallucinations, and sometimes grants insight to the world around them.

The imbiber must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 14) or become {@condition poisoned} for 1d4 hours. Upon a success, the imbiber gains advantage on any Wisdom ability checks for 1 hour. On a saving throw of 19 or 20, the imbiber gains supernatural distance seeing, as though they had cast a {@spell scrying} spell. They may Concentrate on this for up to 1 minute.

item.name: Zeal
entries: Zeal is distilled from the blood of captured or slain {@creature quaggoth} deep from beneath the surface of Nymm. When brewed properly, a thick, purple-colored liquid that tastes of ash remains.

Drinking zeal or applying liberally to exposed skin (requiring an action) forces the user to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 12) or become {@condition paralyzed} for {@dice 1d4} rounds as every muscle seizes up. With a success, the user deals an additional 3 damage to any target it hits with a melee attack for {@dice 2d6} rounds. The user suffers 1 point of {@condition exhaustion} after the effect ends, regardless of saving throw success.

item.name: Suude
entries: Suude is a dangerous, granular substance refined from Gwyhyr ore. Initially developed during the 1st Era by archmages as an incense burned to enhance long spell ritual casting, the secret was discovered and spread among the spellcasting riffraff of Nymm. The varying forms of refinement are dangerous, and can produce one of three different types of suude.

When burned and the fumes inhaled (requiring an action), the imbiber must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 10) or become {@condition unconscious} for {@dice 2d4} rounds. With a success, the user gains 1 Sorcery Point and access to one Metamagic option (as per the Sorcerer class Font of Magic and Metamagic features) for 1 hour based on the type of suude used. If more than one dose of suude is used within 1 hour of another, the DC of the Constitution saving throw is increased by 3 per additional dose. If three or more doses are used within 1 hour of each other, failing the Constitution saving throw drops the user to 0 hit points. Brown suude grants the Extended Spell option, Blue suude grants the Twinned Spell option, and Red suude grants the Distant Spell option.

item.name: Sword of the Ebbenheart
entries: This large curved onyx longsword was taken from the Elves of Ebbenheart, a village in the eastern reaches of the Tauremornalöme forest, and warped by Lady Vess' influence. Etched within the blade are elvish runes which read; "{@i Eglerio imorëtoa amihathel}", or "{@i Praise the Ebony wood upon this blade}" in Common.
Whenever you are attuned to this weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

Also, whenever you are targeted by a spell of 1st through 3rd level and can see where the spell is coming from, you can use your reaction to have the sword swallow the spell. The sword gains a number of charges equal to the spell's level, to a maximum of 3. Whenever you hit with this weapon afterwards, you can expend these charges, dealing {@dice 1d6} force damage per charge spent.
In addition, whenever you score a critical hit using this weapon, you deal an extra {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage, and gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

item.name: Ironleaf Plate
entries: This set of plate armor is lined and overgrown with magical vines and gives you a +1 bonus to your AC. While wearing the armor, its vines seem to move the armor's metal plates when you move, allowing you to ignore the plate armor's normally imposed disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. In addition, the vines are able to absorb some of the impact from blunt attacks, granting you resistance to bludgeoning damage.

When you take fire damage, the leaves wither and lose some of their protection until the start of your next turn. While the leaves are withered in this way, you are not resistant to bludgeoning damage.

While wearing this armor, you can cast the {@spell pass without trace} and {@spell ensnaring strike} spells once without expending a spell slot each. Once you've cast these spells in this way, you can't do so again until the following dawn. In addition, you can cast the {@spell thorn whip} spell at will.

item.name: Targe of the Valiant Protector
entries: This beautiful iron shield is lined and overgrown with magical vines and has spikes that jut from the middle, giving you a +2 bonus to your AC. While wielding this shield, you can use your reaction to cast the {@spell shield} spell once per day. In addition, you can use an action to shield yourself and up to 3 other allies within 10 feet of you by holding the shield forward, creating a large ward and giving everyone (including you) a +2 bonus to AC. Concentrating on this ward on subsequent turns takes an action and works as if you were concentrating on a spell.

You can also use this shield as a weapon to deal {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier piercing damage. This damage is considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance. In addition to this damage, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, or gain the {@condition Bleeding|Nymm} condition.
When you take fire damage, the leaves wither and lose some of their protection until the start of your next turn. While the leaves are withered in this way, you do not gain the +2 bonus to AC.

item.name: Ring of the Weavecaller
entries: This ring has 3 charges. Whenever you cast a spell, you can expend one charge to use one of the following sorcerer Metamagic options on the spell: Careful Spell, Distant Spell, Empowered Spell or Extended Spell. In addition, you can use an action to expend one charge to cast the {@spell arcane eye} spell from the ring. The ring regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Mask of the Trickster
item.reqAttune: by a creature of chaotic good or chaotic neutral alignment that has the ability to cast at least one spell

entries: Trickery is in my blood. Anyway, I've got to bounce, fuckboy!
Whenever you are attuned to this magical mask, you can use an action to cast the {@spell disguise self} spell on yourself at will, requiring no components.
You also gain a +1 bonus to any {@skill deception} checks you make while disguised in this way.
In addition, you can use this mask as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Ziyï's Boots of Lightning

entries: Wheelies!
These short black shoes fit tightly around the wearer’s feet and bear designs of leaping arcs of lightning and wild winds.

Once per day on command, you can transform into lightning and move up to 50 feet in a straight line, re-materializing at the far end of the lightning bolt. Creatures in the path of the lightning take 3d8 lightning damage. If the lightning strikes an object or barrier and fails to burst through it, you appear next to the impacted object and become {@condition stunned} for 1 round. Movement while in lightning form does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

item.name: Glaive of The Spellsword
entries: This long blade has two large scythe-like ends on either side, with a mithral handguard which can be used to deflect weapons.
Whenever you are attuned to this weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, as well as a +2 bonus to AC.

The glaive has 10 charges, which are used to fuel the spells within it. With the glaive in hand, you can use your action to cast one of the following spells from the glaive if the spell is on your class's spell list: {@spell mage armor} (1 charge) or {@spell shield} (2 charges). No components are required.
The glaive regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the glaive's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the glaive shatters and is destroyed.

default: (a) two {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords} or (b) two {@filter simple melee weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=&}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
A {@item longbow|phb} and a {@item quiver|phb} of {@item arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows}

classFeatures.name: Favored Enemy
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy commonly encountered in the wilds.

Choose a type of favored enemy: {@filter beasts|bestiary|type=beast}, {@filter fey|bestiary|type=fey}, {@filter humanoids|bestiary|type=humanoid}, {@filter monstrosities|bestiary|type=monstrosity}, or {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead}. You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with weapon attacks against creatures of the chosen type. Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track your favored enemies, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

When you gain this feature, you also learn one language of your choice, typically one spoken by your favored enemy or creatures associated with it. However, you are free to pick any language you wish to learn.

classFeatures.name: Natural Explorer
entries: You are a master of navigating the natural world, and you react with swift and decisive action when attacked. This grants you the following benefits:

items: You ignore difficult terrain.
You have advantage on initiative rolls.
On your first turn during combat, you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that have not yet acted.

entries: In addition, you are skilled at navigating the wilderness. You gain the following benefits when traveling for an hour or more:

items: Difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel.
Your group can't become lost except by magical means.
Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), you remain alert to danger.
If you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.
When you forage, you find twice as much food as you normally would.
While tracking other creatures, you also learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

classFeatures.name: Spellcasting
entries: By the time you reach 2nd level, you have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells, much as a druid does. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for the {@filter ranger spell list|spells|class=ranger}.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Ranger table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter ranger spells|spells|class=ranger} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell animal friendship} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell animal friendship} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the ranger spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Ranger table shows when you learn more ranger spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the ranger spells you know and replace it with another spell from the ranger spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your ranger spells, since your magic draws on your attunement to nature. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a ranger spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

classFeatures.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Close Quarters Shooter
entries: When making a ranged attack while you are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, you do not have disadvantage on the attack roll. Your ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover against targets within 30 feet of you. You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls on ranged attacks.

entries.name: Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Mariner
entries: As long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield, you have a swimming speed and a climbing speed equal to your normal speed, and you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Tunnel Fighter
